intro: Mougeotia nodiflora, commonly known as the floating star wort, is a freshwater algae belonging to the order Zygnematales. It is characterized by its filamentous structure, with cells arranged in a single row and often forming branching networks. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with nodal swellings that give it its common name. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Mougeotia nodiflora plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
